jobs.title: Senior / Lead Software Engineer (.NET / C#)
jobs.description:
About us

Launched in 2012, Checkout.com is a leading international provider of online payment solutions. Checkout.com is built on 100% proprietary technology and handles every part of the payment process, providing complete transparency across the entire payment value chain.

We currently process 150+ currencies and offer access to all international cards and popular local payment methods to merchants through one integration.

Customers in our portfolio include international businesses like Samsung, Transferwise, Hopper, Virgin and Adidas. Our mission is to partner with smart businesses to optimize their payments, increase revenue and meet the dynamic needs of their customers. 

We are building a unique work environment where our people aspire to solve complex problems and deliver valuable solutions. We believe that excellence can be achieved through a dynamic culture driven by collaboration and teamwork.

Summary

Checkout.com adventure is rocketing and we are looking for driven and talented Senior Software Developers to join/lead our excellence-driven agile squads.
Our goal is to serve millions of shoppers around the world with the most reliable, innovative and secure service-oriented web based payment solution. You will contribute to enhancing our solution across various channels (web, mobile, etc.). Exposed to the entire SDLC, you will work on the specification, design, coding, testing and deployment of various solutions within a Microsoft .NET environment. 
The ideal candidate is passionate and spirited, lives and breathes Agile and firmly believes in creating clean, testable code.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:
- Design, develop, and deliver new features on our RESTful API and related services
- Collaborate with globally distributed and multidisciplinary teams  
- Assist in requirements identification and in producing specifications
- Create and maintain a development environment for efficient testing and integration
- Assist QA to define acceptance tests
- Support the creation and maintenance of technical documentation
- Participate in team knowledge management and make recommendations for continuous improvement of SDLC
- Contribute and adhere to coding standards, best practices, and procedures
- Coach and train squad's junior team mates 

About you

- Solid experience in Software Development, Design and Architecture 
- Mastery of .NET & Core
- Excellent practical knowledge of OOP concepts and SOLID principles
- Solid understanding of HTTP and RESTful design
- Hands-on experience with SQL and NoSQL
- Experience with Unit and Integration testing (NUnit, Moq, FluentValidation, Specflow)
- Experience with Continuous Integration and Deployment workflows
- Knowledge of AWS is beneficial 
- Superb communication skills, ability to interact effectively with multidisciplinary teams
- Fluent in English and C#  

  
Checkout.com is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills and personality. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief. Due to the numerous amount of application received, only the ones corresponding to this job profile will be contacted. If you have not been contacted within 3 weeks please deem your application as unsuccessful.

We are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. We will only process and retain your information as necessary for the purposes of progressing your application or as required by applicable laws and regulations. We may also collect personal information about you through the application and recruitment process, either directly from you or from third-parties (employment agencies, recruitment websites, former employers, credit reference agencies or other background check agencies). In limited circumstances, we may transfer your information to the following countries outside the EU, while making sure your personal data is treated with the same level of protection offered in the EU. Please refer to our Privacy Policy (https://www.checkout.com/legal/privacy-policy) for further information about how your data is being collected, processed and retained at Checkout.com.

Launched in 2012, Checkout.com is a leading international provider of online payment solutions. Checkout.com is built on 100% proprietary technology and handles every part of the payment process, providing complete transparency across the entire payment value chain.

Customers in our portfolio include international businesses like Samsung, Transferwise, Hopper, Virgin and Adidas. Our mission is to partner with smart businesses to optimize their payments, increase revenue and meet the dynamic needs of their customers. 

We are building a unique work environment where our people aspire to solve complex problems and deliver valuable solutions. We believe that excellence can be achieved through a dynamic culture driven by collaboration and teamwork.


ABOUT THE ROLE

Checkout.com are actively for an enthusiastic and talented Sales Manager to join our new office and fast growing Team in Berlin and drive our rapid growth in Germany and the region for our revolutionary online payment solution.

If you are a hands-on and charismatic Sales champion with a successful track record of selling forward-thinking ecommerce/payments solutions in a high-growth, competitive environment, this is the role for you to make a difference. In return, on top of a tremendous working environment, we offer you an unrivalled uncapped commissions plan with recurring commissions! 

From actively sourcing new merchants across preferred lines of business to swimmingly converting inbound leads of all shapes and sizes, you will handle multiple short sales cycles, ensuring a high conversion rate and outperforming your sales targets. Reporting to the Country Manager/VP Sales and collaborating closely with various in-house talents across Technology and Business to position our capabilities, products, services and solutions effectively with prospects.

The ideal candidate will need to be an independent, high-achieving individual, able to stand out in an entrepreneurial environment and outperform sales targets through personal drive.

Your key responsibilities will be to:

- Identify the most promising merchants and verticals that will help Checkout.com grow a healthy pipeline across a preferred line of business across Germany and the region
- Sell our new cross-borders payment solutions and services to ecommerce merchants in the region through cold calling, networking, fairs etc.
- Help new merchants evaluate Checkout.com and handle detailed questions about our product capabilities
- Prepare thorough presentations and proposals for prospective merchants
- Orchestrate the entire Sales process and act as the main point of contact for merchants and other internal stakeholders involved
- Maintain a solid, well-organised portfolio and nurture key accounts
- Partner with other Sales Managers to share best practices, key business insights and industry trends
- Provide feedback on local trends including competitor insights, customer needs, sales, product and marketing information

ABOUT YOU

- 3+ years Sales experience in the ecommerce and/or payments industry
- Solid network of potential prospects or partners in Germany would be preferable
- Excellent knowledge of Salesforce
- Tech-savvy, with a passion for Technology
- Solid business acumen and awareness of financial factors
- Exceptional communication and negotiation skills and techniques
- Highly organised and able to prioritise shifting workloads and responsibilities effectively
- Fluency in English and German

jobs.title: Senior QA Engineer
jobs.description:
About us

Launched in 2012, Checkout.com is a leading international provider of online payment solutions. Checkout.com is built on 100% proprietary technology and handles every part of the payment process, providing complete transparency across the entire payment value chain.

We currently process 150+ currencies and offer access to all international cards and popular local payment methods to merchants through one integration.

Customers in our portfolio include international businesses like Samsung, Transferwise, Hopper, Virgin and Adidas. Our mission is to partner with smart businesses to optimize their payments, increase revenue and meet the dynamic needs of their customers. 

We are building a unique work environment where our people aspire to solve complex problems and deliver valuable solutions. We believe that excellence can be achieved through a dynamic culture driven by collaboration and teamwork.

Summary

Checkout.com is looking for a talented and hands-on Senior QA Engineer. We are looking for someone who is not only thinking about finding bugs or approving stories, but someone who thinks further and will input on our development cycle to find long-term optimum solutions. You will be joining a multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural team, becoming involved from design to deployment to ensure we ship the highest quality payment gateway on the market.

As a Senior QA Engineer you will support the development team by driving the testing strategy for our new releases and existing products. You will be the one tackling bugs, rooting them out, documenting them and stopping them from getting into the system. Your natural problem-solving skills, your inquisitive mind and your attention to detail will have a huge impact on the quality of our product.

The ideal candidate must be a hands-on and passionate technologist, with the ability to perform in a fast paced agile environment.

Key Responsibilities

> Perform test scoping, estimation, preparation and execution for application enhancements and bug fixes.
> Administer detailed test plans, progress reports and end of test reports.
> Analyse requirements documentation and provide constructive feedback with detailed test estimations.
> Liaise with product managers, business analysts and developers to accurately understand the systems and produce effective test scripts and execution plans.
> Proactively engage with all stakeholders to close gaps in requirements
> Define test scenarios based on business requirements written in the Gherkin language format.
> Debug, record and manage defects throughout their lifecycle.
> Own manual integration test activities on the core application service using REST API clients and database query tools.
> Author new and update existing automated integration tests of all the core business APIs.
> Maintain automation test suites and provide regular feedback for continuous improvement
> Provide team demos and conduct learning sessions to ensure fluid collaboration and knowledge share within the QA and wider development teams

Skills & Experience

> 5+ years of professional experience within e-commerce or e-payments
> Strong QA background in REST API and Web GUI testing
> Good experience with manual and automated testing tools 
> Excellent fault finding, debugging and diagnostic skills
> Experienced scripting in at least 1 coding language, preferably JavaScript
> Proven experience designing and implementing test plans and complex test scenarios
> Comfortable in an Agile environment with rapid application development
> Extremely organised, methodical but remain logical and realistic to achieve targets
> Confident collaborating with technical and non-technical stakeholders whilst taking full ownership of all test activities within your scope
> Bachelor’s degree in engineering or computer science preferred
> Fluent in written and spoken English

- 4+ years of professional experience within e-commerce or Fintech

Checkout.com is looking for an ambitious and talented Risk & Fraud Associate to join our growing Team and support the risk assessment and monitoring of our global e-commerce merchants portfolio. The candidate will apply in-house methodology and use available reporting tools to conduct reliable and pro-active risk profiling, and report on risk to Management. Another key element of this role is to ensure that the company provides a transparent fraud management service by generating regular assessments of internal process and propose continuous improvement solutions. 

The ideal candidate enjoys dealing with figures and is diligent and inquisitive, with a thorough attention to detail. This role requires proficiency on Excel and an ability to approach problems in a quantitative and qualitative manner.


Key responsibilities 
- Review any case of suspected fraud reported and take appropriate actions accordingly
- Regularly and pro-actively generate/review reports to early identify unusual processing patterns 
- Conduct analysis and investigation on any merchant’s suspected fraudulent transactions by using multiple resources including customer contact, contacting banks and credit card issuer 
- Create and communicate reports to Management and dedicated Relationship Managers on any concerns regarding existing merchant’s portfolio 
- Formulate and execute chargeback/fraud mitigation plans 
- Monitor merchant performance under card association risk compliance rules
- Maintain a strong relationship between merchants, acquiring banks and internal stakeholders 
- Educate merchants on the fraud and chargeback management platform to support them 
- Maintain an in-depth working knowledge of Card Scheme rules 
- Review and promptly attend to customers’ requests through Checkout.com’s ticketing system 
- Propose solutions to continuously improve current processes and procedures 


About you
- A Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Risk Management / Finance/Statistics/Actuarial/Business or equivalent.
- 1-2 years of experience in e-commerce and/or in banking (risk department) and/or in financial services would be appreciated
- Solution driven approach, with exemplary problem solving and analytical skills 
- Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present analysis and recommendation in a succinct manner
- Excellent and demonstrated customer service skills

jobs.description:

We currently process 150+ currencies and offer access to all international cards and popular local payment methods to merchants through one integration.

In May 2019, we raised $230m in what is Europe’s largest ever fintech Series A round, and globally the third largest fintech Series A round of all time. This fundraising round gave us a valuation of around $2 billion.

About the role 

As a Senior Development Engineer in Test, you will have full ownership of the test strategy for your product including the creation of clean and repeatable automation tests. Your natural problem-solving skills, inquisitive mind and attention to detail will contribute towards a strong culture of quality across the organisation and have a significant impact on the service we provide.

About the Team - Tech Finance  

A suite of products responsible for enhancing and optimisation Checkout.com’s financial processes, becoming the golden source and distribution hub of financial data to a variety of end user groups. With Checkout.com’s fast paced growth and complex business domain we thrive in the ongoing challenges of data integrity, granularity, and scalability.

The Tech Finance Products

Fort - our proprietary greenfield financial reconciliation and treasury management tool has numerous exciting technical challenges. With a complex and evolving business domain and a rapidly increasing volume of transactions, there are huge learning opportunities here. CQRS architecture with horizontal scaling and event sourcing are just some interesting technical aspects.
Merlin - Checkout’s internal ledger system, the source of truth, we expose this data via various reports and external facing APIs posing unique challenges in building for scale while maintaining integrity. We are making use of event driven design patterns along with PostgreSQL, Aurora MySQL and DynamoDB.

- **Connecting teams** : connecting the dots between Commercial and Product teams to ensure a continuous feedback loop, and working with the Sales Operations team to operationalise this

- **Tools & materials** : develop collateral to communicate the core value of our products value and how they work to internal and external audiences

- **Competitive analysis** : ensure there are appropriate mechanisms and materials in place to capture and share competitive intelligence
- **Product roadmap** : ensure a strong understanding among Commercial teams of the roadmap, including messaging and strategic vision
- **Partner propositions** : work with Partnerships team on joint value propositions for strategic partners

- Experience in delivering content in a global organisaton

Technical Stack

Passionate about technology but not evangelists of any single one sums up our approach to technology selection, all developers are empowered to understand and question technology choice, an increasing number of our teams own the entire DevOps model for their products. The following are examples of technologies and frameworks used commonly throughout the business:

- .Net Core 3.1
- Various SQL and NoSQL offerings
- Microservices based architectures
- AWS
- Terraform

Many ongoing and upcoming technical projects here at Checkout.com are focused around the scalability and optimisation of high performant systems, so if the above stack and the challenges facing a fast-scaling, technically focused company interest you, hopefully you can make a great impact here! 

About the Team - Tech Finance  

A suite of products responsible for enhancing and optimisation Checkout.com’s financial processes, becoming the golden source and distribution hub of financial data to a variety of end user groups. With Checkout.com’s fast paced growth and complex business domain we thrive in the ongoing challenges of data integrity, granularity, and scalability.

The Tech Finance Products

Fort - our proprietary greenfield financial reconciliation and treasury management tool has numerous exciting technical challenges. With a complex and evolving business domain and a rapidly increasing volume of transactions, there are huge learning opportunities here. CQRS architecture with horizontal scaling and event sourcing are just some interesting technical aspects.
Merlin - Checkout’s internal ledger system, the source of truth, we expose this data via various reports and external facing APIs posing unique challenges in building for scale while maintaining integrity. We are making use of event driven design patterns along with PostgreSQL, Aurora MySQL and DynamoDB.
FinDev - this is the domain critical to ensuring accurate pricing on all merchant transactions. It ingests financial data from various sources and applies business logic to drive ledger movements. It's a complex and evolving business domain with high throughput requirements.


About You
- Passionate about technology and experience using the above mentioned technical stack
- A wide understanding and appreciation for software design and architecture
- Strong communicator who thrives in collaborative environments and teams
- Enthusiastic about delivery and have experience working in a fast paced agile environment
- Desire to work on an exciting product suite, core to the continued success of a fast scaling technical business

About the Role
 
As the VP of Credit Risk, you will play a key role in the Risk Department, providing leadership and strategic direction in the management of credit risk across the Checkout.com portfolio. Your primary responsibility will be to manage credit risk at Checkout.com and you will oversee the Credit Risk Policy Framework governing credit risk management during the customer lifecycle, across different teams within the Operations division and across the different jurisdictions whereCheckout.com operates. 
 
You will be required to work closely with both internal and external stakeholders in establishing onboarding and monitoring standards by building credit risk models using quantitative and qualitative data. You will also be actively contributing to Checkout.com’s Enterprise Risk Management efforts and shaping the company’s Credit Risk Strategy with Senior Management. 
 
The VP of Credit Risk will have significant autonomy to develop the function and lead a team of analysts and financial risk management professionals, overseeing the company’s credit risk mitigation efforts.


Key Responsibilities 
- Oversee the  Credit Risk Policy Framework for the [Checkout.com](http://Checkout.com) group 
- Lead a team of risk analysts to manage credit risk across the [Checkout.com](http://Checkout.com) portfolio
- Oversee the design and maintenance of advanced credit loss and financial risk forecasting models in collaboration with the Risk Analytics Team
- Define onboarding credit risk standards
- Analyse financial information of small to large enterprise merchants and use key metrics to set collateral/reserves and ongoing monitoring of financial health 
- Establish approval authorities for sign-off on volume limits based on credit ratings
- Maintain policies on reserves/collateral and merchant funding 
- Define credit risk monitoring standards and KPIs at merchant, acquirer and other group levels by setting thresholds and escalation procedures
- Collaborate with the Finance Team to define fraud loss budgets 
- Assess concentration risk of specific industries/merchants within the [Checkout.com](http://Checkout.com) portfolio
- Monitor economic trends that could potentially impact the portfolio if a specific industry faces a crisis or other challenges 
- Collaborate with the Finance Team to review portfolio reserves against risk exposure at enterprise level 
- Set thresholds and criteria for terminations based on probability of default or credit losses
- Use predictive models to assess reserves and funding requirements after termination of a merchant
- Develop collection and workout processes 
- Manage  credit risk reporting including performance, trends and other relevant insights on the portfolio
- Monitor regulatory changes and industry trends
- Provide guidance and training to staff on credit risk policies, standards and procedures


About You
- 7+ years of experience in credit risk management, preferably in the payments industry, in a supervisory or managerial capacity
- Holds a bachelor’s degree and other relevant specialised professional qualifications or training
- Demonstrate sound understanding of the financial services industry
- Highly skilled in quantitative methods and financial risk modelling
- Strong knowledge of regulatory capital frameworks
- Solution-driven approach, with excellent problem solving and analytical skills
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Knowledge of card schemes rules and regulations would be an advantage
- Ability to manage a team across different jurisdictions

The role will require partnering with multiple areas of the broader Finance function, including Management accounting, FP&A, Tax and Corporate Finance departments.
 
The VP Treasury will oversee full treasury movements within the company’s global acquiring network, utilising internal tools & reporting to manage and forecast global settlements, pay-outs and daily cash flow position. The VP Treasury will also maintain a full set of policies and procedures that ensure an adequate level of control over treasury activities, as well as financial risk management procedures.
 
The ideal candidate is result-driven, able to work with minimum supervision within a high intensity, fast-paced and multi-tasking environment.


Key Responsibilities
- Oversight of treasury movements within the company’s global acquiring network
- Manage and forecast global settlements, pay-outs and daily cash flow position
- Utilise a range of corporate banking & FinTech partners to continually optimise the group’s domestic balances, liquidity, and funds available for investment
- Work closely with FP&A function to plan ongoing operational & capital investment requirements
- Oversee the group’s multi-currency processing, settlement and payout activities, utilising a range of partners and solutions for optimal FX trading
- Manage hedging to mitigate financial risks and foreign exchange positions
- Oversee day to day operational finance matters
- Maintain targeted banking relationships, in partnership with the Strategic Finance function
- Oversee and manage reporting of liquidity to management as part of ongoing MIS
- Manage investment of excess liquidity utilising the asset management functions of partner banks
- Input on relevant features of current product roadmap that touches on treasury movements


About You
- 10+ years track record managing large and complex treasury movements in an international setup
- Experience in Payments (Acquiring / Issuing) desirable but not required
- Experience utilising BI reporting tools (Looker/Power BI/Tableau etc) is desirable
- Mastery of financial modelling and analytics
- Highly analytical, strategic thinker with strong judgement and foresight 
- Track record managing a fast-growing team with a range of skillsets
- Experience overseeing controls and mitigating operational and financial risk
- Confident in synthesising and presenting relevant information to a senior audience
- Degree in Finance or Accounting
- Experience working with senior management


Checkout.com is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience, skills and personality. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief. Due to the numerous amount of application received, only the ones corresponding to this job profile will be contacted. If you have not been contacted within 3 weeks please deem your application as unsuccessful.

We are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. We will only process and retain your information as necessary for the purposes of progressing your application or as required by applicable laws and regulations. We may also collect personal information about you through the application and recruitment process, either directly from you or from third-parties (employment agencies, recruitment websites, former employers, credit reference agencies or other background check agencies). In limited circumstances, we may transfer your information to the following countries outside the EU, while making sure your personal data is treated with the same level of protection offered in the EU. Please refer to our Privacy Policy (https://www.checkout.com/legal/privacy-policy) for further information about how your data is being collected, processed and retained at Checkout.com.

About us

Launched in 2012, Checkout.com is a leading international provider of online payment solutions. Checkout.com is built on 100% proprietary technology and handles every part of the payment process, providing complete transparency across the entire payment value chain.

We currently process 150+ currencies and offer access to all international cards and popular local payment methods to merchants through one integration.

Customers in our portfolio include international businesses like Samsung, Transferwise, Hopper, Virgin and Adidas. Our mission is to partner with smart businesses to optimise their payments, increase revenue and meet the dynamic needs of their customers.

We are building a unique work environment where our people aspire to solve complex problems and deliver valuable solutions. We believe that excellence can be achieved through a dynamic culture driven by collaboration and teamwork.

In May 2019, we raised $230m in what is Europe’s largest ever fintech Series A round, and globally the third largest fintech Series A round of all time. This fundraising round gave us a valuation of around $2 billion.
